meanings.definition: The methods or practices of a demagogue.
meanings.sent1: The demagoguery of the politician involved manipulating emotions to sway public opinion.
meanings.sent2: His demagoguery was evident in his inflammatory speeches that aimed to incite fear and anger.
meanings.sent3: The demagoguery of the salesman trying to sell the miracle cure was so exaggerated that it made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her demagoguery in the debate was like a dark cloud overshadowing the truth.
meanings.sent5: The demagoguery of the cult leader was so persuasive that it led many astray.

meanings.definition: The use of popular prejudices and false claims to gain power.
meanings.sent1: The demagoguery of the tabloid relied on sensationalism and exploiting people's biases.
meanings.sent2: The rise of the dictator was fueled by his demagoguery, playing on people's fears and prejudices.
meanings.sent3: The demagoguery of the gossip columnist was so outrageous that it became a parody of itself.
meanings.sent4: His demagoguery in the election campaign was like a poisonous snake charmer, hypnotizing the masses.
meanings.sent5: The demagoguery of the conspiracy theorist painted a vivid but false picture of reality.
